abstracts

Class Pokeman

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstracts.Pokeman
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arbok, Bulbasaur, Butterfree, Eevee, Fearow, Kadabra, Mew, Nidorino, Pikachu, Sandslash

    public abstract class Pokeman
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a pokeman. The pokeman has a name, level, catch rate, and run rate.
    Author:
    Andrew Rickus, Todd Wickizer, Sean Gemberling

    • Method Detail

      • tryToCatch

        public boolean tryToCatch(int angry,
                          int eating)
        tryToCatch Checks a randomly generated number against an equation using the angry and eating stats. If the random number is lower than the calculated number, the pokeman is caught.
        Parameters:
        angry - The angry stat of the pokeman, modified by throwing rocks.
        eating - The eating stat of the pokemon, modified by throwing bait.
        Returns:

      • checkRun

        public boolean checkRun()
        Generates a random number and checks if the pokemon can run by comparing it to the toRun stat.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the pokemon can run, false otherwise.

      • getSprite

        Returns:
        BufferedImage The sprite for the Pokeman

      • tryToRun

        public boolean tryToRun(int battleLength,
                        int angry,
                        int eating)
        Calculates the run chance of the Pokeman, using the battlelength, eating, and angry stats. If the battle length is greater than 10, or if the toRun stat is greater than the random value generated in checkRun, the Pokemon runs.
        Parameters:
        battleLength - The length of the current battle
        angry - The angry stat of the Pokeman
        eating - The eating stat of the Pokeman
        Returns:
        boolean True if the Pokeman runs ,false if it does not.
